title: Australia Delivers ‘Dovish’ Rate Cut, Sends Yields Tumbling
content: Australia’s central bank cut its key interest rate for a second time this year, highlighting mounting trade-related uncertainty and sending the currency and government bond yields tumbling.

title: Quantinuum CEO Rajeeb Hazra on US-Qatar Quantum Deal
content: Rajeeb Hazra, President & CEO of Quantinuum speaks to Bloomberg's Tom Mackenzie from the annual Qatar Economic Forum in Doha about their new deal with the US as it becomes one of the partnerships in the $1 billion fund the US has set aside to invest in quantum technologies. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Mizuho Waits for Next Opportunity After Cutting Bond Positions
content: Mizuho Financial Group Inc. is managing its securities portfolio “very conservatively” as Japan’s third-largest lender prepares for the next investing opportunity after shrinking its bond holdings.

title: QEF Kicks Off in Doha; Israel To 'Take Over' Gaza | Horizons Middle East & Africa 05/20/2025
content: US President Donald Trump says Russia and Ukraine will begin truce talks immediately. Also on the show: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says Israel will take over the entire Gaza Strip; Nigeria's policymakers look set to keep rates steady for a second straight meeting. Guests include: Satyajit Singh, Emirates NBD, Head of Fixed Income Strategy; Aminu Umar-Sadiq, Nigeria's Sovereign Investment Authority, Managing Director and CEO; Sorana Parvulescu, Control Risks, Partner EMEA. title: China Imports the Most Platinum in a Year as Squeeze Tightens
content: Chinese jewelers and investors imported the most platinum in a year last month, as the precious metal’s relative stability enhanced its attractiveness over surging and volatile gold.

title: Hungary’s Lawmakers Back Exit From International Criminal Court
content: Hungarian lawmakers approved the exit from the International Criminal Court, cementing another move by Prime Minister Viktor Orban away from the European mainstream.

title: Insight with Haslinda Amin 5/20/2025
content: Insight with Haslinda Amin, a daily news program featuring in-depth, high-profile interviews and analysis to give viewers the complete picture on the stories that matter. The show features prominent leaders spanning the worlds of business, finance, politics and culture. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Japan Bonds Plunge After Weak Auction Stokes Fear of BOJ Retreat
content: The slump in Japanese bonds worsened Tuesday after the weakest demand at a government debt auction in more than a decade highlighted concern over the central bank’s retreat from the market.

title: Asian Stocks Rise as Trade Tensions Ebb, Gold Dips: Markets Wrap
content: Asian shares rose for the first time in four days, putting a regional gauge close to levels last seen in October as trade tensions continue to tamp down.

title: Carlyle’s Rubenstein Sees US Deficit as Bigger Issue Than Trade
content: Tackling the widening US fiscal deficit is a bigger issue than tariffs, which are likely to fade from view by the time of the midterm elections in Congress next year, according to Carlyle Group Inc. co-founder David Rubenstein.

title: Sasol CEO Says Chemical-Unit Listing Possible Before 2030
content: Sasol Ltd. may list its international chemical business “towards the end of the decade,” following a turnaround of the business that’s underway, according to Chief Executive Officer Simon Baloyi.

title: Oil Edges Down as Trump Retreats From Ukraine-Russia Peace Talks
content: Oil edged lower after a two-day gain, as the market digested signs that US President Donald Trump is pulling back from his efforts to end the war between Ukraine and Russia.

title: Trump Touts MidEast Tour
content: Live from the Qatar Economic Forum in Doha, Bloomberg’s Joumanna Bercetche breaks down President Trump’s recent tour of the Middle East, as well as the impact of the latest from Gaza. She joins Bloomberg’s Tom Mackenzie on “Bloomberg: Daybreak Europe.” (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Elon Musk, Qatar’s Al-Thani to Speak at Economic Forum
content: The Katara Towers ahead of the Qatar Economic Forum. Photographer: Christopher Pike/Bloomberg

title: FTSE 100 Live: UK Stocks Poised to Rise, Pound Nears $1.34
Honda Walks Back EV Investment, Sales Targets on Poor Demand
content: Honda Motor Co. scaled back investment plans and lowered sales targets for electric vehicles, as consumer demand remains lackluster and environmental regulations are weakened in major markets abroad.

title: Malaysia Trade Jumps to Near Three-Year High Amid Front-Loading
content: Malaysia’s trade rose to an almost three-year high, with exports surpassing expectations amid front-loading activity.

title: Toyota Industries Shares Surge as Buyout Expectations Grow
content: Shares of Toyota Industries Corp. surged as much as 9%, the most since April 28, after a report that the firm is set to accept a buyout offer from Akio Toyoda, chair of Toyota Motor Corp.

title: Nigeria Sovereign Wealth Fund CEO: "The US Is the US"
content: Aminu Umar-Sadiq, Nigeria Sovereign Investment Authority MD & CEO said "the US is the US" when speaking to BTV's Joumanna Bercetche and Jennifer Zabasajja at the Qatar Economic Forum in Doha. When asked about the fund's future, he explained how for their long portfolio they have pivoted away from the US to Japan, Australia, and Europe for the purposes of diversification, insisting there were no "political considerations" during their decision. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: US Huawei Curbs Reverberate At Taiwan Tech Event
content: Excitement over new tech innovations at Taipei's Computex is tempered by a backdrop of US-China tensions over Chinese semiconductor manufacturer Huawei. The Chinese government has accused the Trump administration of undermining recent trade talks in Geneva after it warned that using Huawei's artificial intelligence chips “anywhere in the world” would violate US export controls. Annabelle Droulers reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Sasol Offsets a Strategy to Run Coal Harder With More Renewables
content: Sasol Ltd. plans to run its flagship plant at full capacity, offsetting the use of coal feedstock by sourcing more renewables as part of a strategy by the world’s top producer of synthetic fuel from coal to improve its business.

title: Bloomberg: The China Show 05/20/2025
content: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. From politics and policy to tech and trends, Yvonne Man and David Ingles give global investors unique insight, delivering in-depth discussions with the newsmakers who matter. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Markets Snap Back, But Moody’s Was On to Something
content: The message to ratings agencies: You’re overrated. But the reality? Look deeper.

title: JPMorgan, Citi See European Stocks Beating US by Most in Decades
content: Some Wall Street strategists are betting European stocks will enjoy their best performance relative to the US in at least two decades as the region’s economic outlook improves.

title: Bloomberg: The Asia Trade 05/20/2025
content: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Sydney and Singapore with Haidi Stroud-Watts and Avril Hong, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Hong Kong Dollar Funding Cost Drops in FX Intervention Aftermath
content: Hong Kong’s key interbank borrowing cost slumped following foreign-exchange intervention by the city’s authorities, fueling bearish bets against the local dollar.

title: RBA Sees Unemployment Rise to Near 6% in a ‘Trade War’ Scenario
content: Australia’s central bank warned that the unemployment rate would climb to nearly 6% in a “trade war” scenario where the US re-imposes higher ‘Liberation Day’ tariffs in 2026 and all countries retaliate.

title: Gold Falls as Haven Demand From Moody’s Downgrade Fades
content: Gold fell as the haven-demand boost from Moody’s Ratings downgrade of the US faded, and attention turned back to the easing of trade tensions between the two largest economies.

title: Nigeria to Hold Rates Again on Hazy Inflation Outlook
content: Policymakers at Nigeria’s central bank are set to keep the key interest rate on hold for a second straight meeting to get a better grasp of the inflation trajectory.

title: Britain’s EU Reset Turns Out to Be Just the Start of Talks
content: Prime Minister Keir Starmer heralded a “landmark deal” between the UK and the European Union on Monday that he billed as a reset moment for relations under his government. Still, with many details unresolved, Brexit never quite seems to be over.

title: Orban Moves to Root Out Dissent a Year Before Hungary’s Election
content: Two years after Prime Minister Viktor Orban returned to power in 2010, he told an audience of entrepreneurs that Hungary was a nation that he “hoped to God” wouldn’t one day need to replace democracy. Hungarians are now wondering if their leader is doing just that.

title: Taiwan’s Lai Toughens China Stance, Stoking Debate on Democracy
content: As President Lai Ching-te marks his first year in office, he’s sending a stark warning to the people of Taiwan: If you say anything that threatens the archipelago’s security, there will be consequences.

title: Taiwan Plans Wealth Fund to Counter China With Global Expansion
content: President Lai Ching-te said Taiwan would set up a sovereign wealth fund to help its companies expand globally — a move that would tighten Taipei’s ties to markets around the world and counter China’s attempts to isolate it.

title: China Gives EU Business Groups High-Level Meetings to Boost Ties
content: China is giving European business leaders its warmest welcome in years, in an effort to strengthen ties as Beijing seeks to counter Donald Trump’s tariff pressure and stabilize its slowing economy.

title: SALT Agreement Remains Elusive for House GOP on Trump Tax Bill
content: House Speaker Mike Johnson emerged from a late-night meeting Monday with holdout Republicans from New York and other high-tax states saying they had made “lots of progress” on a deal over the divisive state and local tax deduction.

title: China Accuses US of Undermining Trade Talks With Warnings Against Huawei Chips
content: The Chinese government accused the Trump administration of undermining recent trade talks in Geneva after it warned that using Huawei Technologies Co.’s artificial-intelligence chips “anywhere in the world” would violate US export controls.

title: Thailand Eyes $15 Billion Cut in US Trade Gap With Export Rules
content: Thailand expects to reduce its trade gap with the US by as much as $15 billion annually with its recent initiatives to prevent the misuse of origin rules for exports, according to Finance Minister Pichai Chunhavajira.

title: Australia’s Liberal-National Coalition Splits After Decades
content: Australia’s decades-long Liberal-National tie-up will end after the leader of the National Party, David Littleproud, said his party won’t form another coalition agreement with the Liberal Party.

title: India Expects Multi-Phase Trade Deal With US as Talks Proceed
content: India is discussing a US trade deal structured in three tranches and expects to reach an interim agreement before July, when President Donald Trump’s reciprocal tariffs are set to kick in, according to officials in New Delhi familiar with the matter.

title: Japan’s Kato Plans Bessent Meet to Discuss Topics Including FX
content: Japan’s Finance Minister said he’s arranging a bilateral meeting with US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent this week to discuss topics including currency matters, triggering further gains in the yen.

title: Japan Minister’s Brag About Free Rice Misfires Amid Surging Prices
content: Japan’s agriculture minister said he’d been inconsiderate after comments about his plentiful supply of free rice struck a nerve with the public, who face soaring prices in stores.

title: Stablecoin Bill Advances in US Senate in Big Win for Crypto
content: Stablecoin legislation overcame a procedural blockade in the US Senate, marking a major victory for the crypto industry after a group of Democrats dropped their opposition Monday.

title: NJ Congresswoman Charged With Assault in ICE Protest, Prosecutor Says
content: The Justice Department charged a Democratic House lawmaker from Newark, New Jersey, with assault after a confrontation with US immigration officers on May 9 at a private detention center that is central to President Donald Trump’s plans for mass deportations, a prosecutor said.

title: US Offers $10 Million for Tips on Hezbollah in Latin America
content: The US Department of State is offering a reward of up to $10 million for information on Hezbollah’s activities and connections in Latin America.

title: France, UK, Canada Call on Israel to Allow More Aid to Gaza
content: The leaders of France, Britain and Canada called on Israel to stop its military operations in Gaza and allow humanitarian aid to enter the territory.

title: Rich Americans Ready to Swoop In If New Zealand Relaxes Home-Buying Ban
content: Wealthy Americans eying New Zealand as a haven are hoping the government will soon relax a ban on house sales to foreigners, according to advisers.

title: Trump Plans to Rally House Republicans Divided on Tax Cut Bill
content: President Donald Trump plans to go to the Capitol on Tuesday to urge fractious House Republicans to overcome divisions and unite behind his signature tax-cut legislation.

title: UK Benefit Cuts to Cause More Pain Than Gain, Think Tank Finds
content: Labour’s benefit cuts will leave hundreds of thousands more Britons in poverty even after accounting for the employment boost the government claims the reform plans will deliver, according to analysis by the Resolution Foundation think tank.

title: Trump Hands Putin Win With Retreat From Ukraine Peace Talks
content: Eleven days ago, European leaders took heart when President Donald Trump called for a 30-day ceasefire in Ukraine and threatened new sanctions on Russia. A telephone call with Vladimir Putin on Monday revealed those hopes were misplaced.

title: Chicago Mayor’s Hiring Practices Probed by Justice Department
content: The US Department of Justice said it will investigate whether Chicago is discriminating against municipal job candidates by race after Mayor Brandon Johnson highlighted the number of Black officials in his administration while addressing a church on the city’s south side.

title: US Court Orders Return of Another Deportee From El Salvador
content: The Trump administration was ordered by an appeals court to facilitate the return of a Venezuelan man who was deported to a maximum-security prison in El Salvador — at least the second time the administration has been told to bring back a migrant it wrongly removed.

title: Supreme Court Lets Trump End Venezuelan Migrant Protections
content: The Supreme Court let the Trump administration end legal protections for 350,000 Venezuelans, stripping them of the right to temporarily live and work in the US and opening many of them to the prospect of deportation.

title: Senator Asks SEC to Probe Firms Advising Against JBS Listing
content: Kentucky Senator Rand Paul has asked the top US securities regulator to probe two major firms that have advised their clients to vote against a proposed New York listing by JBS SA, the world’s largest meat producer.

title: FDA Names Acting Leaders for Inspections, Tobacco Regulation
content: US Food and Drug Administration Commissioner Marty Makary named agency veterans to lead tobacco regulation and inspections, two high-profile areas, according to documents seen by Bloomberg.

title: Harvard President Seeks Alumni Help to Boost Case Against Trump
content: Harvard University President Alan Garber is asking alumni who want to support the school in its standoff with the Trump administration for three things: their attention, their voices and their money.

content: Democratic Senator Elizabeth Warren queried chicken producer Pilgrim’s Pride Corp. and its parent company JBS USA over the meat processor’s donation to Donald Trump’s Inaugural Committee.

content: President Donald Trump signed a bill to force social media companies to remove non-consensual sharing of explicit sexual imagery online, calling it a “horribly wrong” situation.

title: Trump Hands Putin Win With Retreat From Ukraine Talks
content:
Eleven days ago, European leaders took heart when President Donald Trump called for a 30-day ceasefire in Ukraine and threatened new sanctions on Russia. A telephone call with Vladimir Putin on Monday revealed those hopes were misplaced. After two hours talking with Putin, Trump said on social media that Ukraine and Russia would "immediately start negotiations" toward a ceasefire — but possibly without the US. There was no sanctions threat, no demand for a time-line, and no pressure on the Russian leader. Trump followed the Putin call by reaching out to European leaders, but already several governments were airing their disappointment. 

After months of failing to move Putin closer to peace, they fear Trump is pulling back from his efforts to end the war, leaving Ukraine and its allies on their own. Our EMEA News Director Rosalind Mathieson joined Stephen Carroll and Caroline Hepker on Bloomberg radio to discuss.  (Source: Bloomberg)

Alongside the increased attacks, Israel will start allowing aid into Gaza again after stopping it in early March in a bid to make Hamas release hostages and surrender, Netanyahu added. title: Grab, GoTo Targeted by Indonesia Drivers’ Protest for Better Pay
content: Grab Holdings Ltd. and GoTo Group ride-hailing and delivery services are set to be disrupted on Tuesday in Indonesia, their biggest market, with tens of thousands of drivers preparing to protest over compensation and other terms.

title: Trump’s Mideast Chips Deals Imperil US National Security, Democrats Warn
content: Key Senate Democrats urged the Trump administration to revisit new artificial intelligence deals with Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates, saying that expanded sales of AI chips to the Middle Eastern countries risk exposing advanced technology to China and Russia, while potentially limiting supplies available for American companies.

title: China Accuses US of Undermining Trade Talks With Warnings Against Huawei Chips
content: The Chinese government accused the Trump administration of undermining recent trade talks in Geneva after it warned that using Huawei Technologies Co.’s artificial-intelligence chips “anywhere in the world” would violate US export controls.

title: Nintendo Turns to Samsung to Make Chips, Ramp Up Switch 2 Output
content: Nintendo Co. has turned to Samsung Electronics Co. to help make the main chips for the Switch 2, a move that may help the Japanese company ramp up production of the gaming console enough to sell a higher-than-projected 20 million units by March 2026.

title: CATL Rises in HK Debut After World’s Top Listing This Year
content: Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. rose in its Hong Kong trading debut after the Chinese battery giant wrapped up the world’s biggest listing this year by raising HK$35.7 billion ($4.6 billion) despite being blacklisted by the Pentagon and grinding through geopolitical storms.

title: Bithumb Claims Larger Slice of Korea’s Crypto Space Ahead of IPO
content: After years spent in the shadow of larger rival Upbit, crypto exchange Bithumb is clawing back a more meaningful share of South Korea’s tightly held digital-assets market.

title: Nvidia Opens AI Ecosystem to Rivals, Apple AI Struggles | Bloomberg Technology
content: Bloomberg’s Ed Ludlow breaks down why the Magnificent Seven are lower on Monday as investor sentiment sours more broadly following Moody’s US credit downgrade. Plus, Nvidia says it will allow customers to use rival chipmakers in an effort to expand its AI ecosystem, and Apple has been spending billions of dollars on AI but insiders say it still can't get it right. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Thoma Bravo Nears Deal for Insurance Tech Firm Itel
content: Buyout firm Thoma Bravo is in advanced talks to acquire to acquire GTCR-backed Itel, an insurance technology firm focused on property and casualty claims services, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

title: Pony AI Earnings Put Investors on Alert for Robotaxi Expansion
content: Pony AI Inc.’s report on its first full quarter as a publicly traded company will have investors and analysts homing in on how a new generation of robotaxis could put the firm on a path to profitability.

title: Google Decided Against Offering Publishers Options in AI Search
content: Company drew “hard red line” around requiring web publishers to participate in AI search, document says

title: US Battery Startup ONE Inks Production Deal With Turkey’s Pomega
content: US battery startup Our Next Energy Inc. will outsource some production of its battery cells to Turkey’s Pomega Enerji Depolama Teknolojileri AS.

title: Lyft Revives Pooled Rides at Airports in Push for Cheaper Trips
content: Lyft Inc. is bringing back cheaper shared trips at airports, reversing a decision made two years ago to discontinue the ride option as it seeks to compete with rival Uber Technologies Inc. in courting inflation-weary consumers.

title: Apple Must Resolve ‘Fortnite’ Return or Answer for It to Judge
content: Apple Inc. will have to answer to a judge for refusing to restore Fortnite to its US App Store if it hasn’t resolved its standoff with Epic Games Inc. by May 27.

title: Rio Tinto Strikes Another Lithium Deal With Codelco Venture
content: Rio Tinto Group agreed to invest in a Chilean lithium project controlled by Codelco as the world’s second-biggest miner continues its expansion into the battery metal.

title: Microsoft Is Bringing Elon Musk’s AI Models to Its Cloud
content: Microsoft Corp. is adding models from Elon Musk’s xAI to its artificial intelligence marketplace.

title: Nvidia Opens AI Ecosystem to Rival Chipmakers in Global Push
content: Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang outlined plans to let customers deploy rival chips in data centers built around its technology, a move that acknowledges the growth of in-house semiconductor development by major clients such as Microsoft Corp. and Amazon.com Inc.

title: Aramco, Saudi Telecom Join Sequoia in Backing US-Based Startup Graphiant
content: The venture capital arms of Saudi Arabia’s oil and telecom giants have invested in US tech startup Graphiant Inc. as the kingdom seeks to drive innovation and develop its digital economy.

title: Salesforce Cuts Slack Price for US Government, Following Google
content: Salesforce Inc. will offer its Slack application to the federal government at a discounted rate, the latest software company to cut prices as the Trump administration aims to slash technology costs.

title: China Says US Chip Controls Are Undermining Trade Consensus
content: China sees the US as undermining the consensus reached between the two countries during trade talks in Geneva, a spokesperson for the Asian nation’s commerce ministry says.

content: Sanmina Corp. is buying Advanced Micro Devices Inc.’s AI server assembly plants in a deal worth as much as $3 billion.

content: Nvidia Corp. and Abu Dhabi investment vehicle MGX are partnering with French firms to establish what they say will be Europe’s largest artificial intelligence data center campus, advancing French and Emirati ambitions in the field.

title: Apple’s $100 Billion-a-Year App Store Will Never Be the Same
content: Apple’s $100 billion-a-year App Store business will never be the same again after getting upended by lawsuits. Also: Inside Apple’s artificial intelligence crisis and what comes next; new details on iOS 19, iPadOS 19 and visionOS 3; and CarPlay Ultra is finally ready — if you can afford it.

title: UK Legal Aid Hack Includes ‘Significant Amount’ of Personal Data
content: Hackers have stolen a “significant amount of personal data” from people who received legal aid across England and Wales, the UK’s Ministry of Justice said.

title: Saudi Arabia, UAE See AI Buildup as Key to Post-Oil Power
content: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Omar El Chmouri analyzes the efforts by the Gulf states to gain powerful chips for artificial intelligence from leading US chipmakers.

title: Telefonica’s Latin America Fire-Sale Sends Chile Unit to New Low
content: Bonds of Telefonica Moviles Chile SA slumped into distressed territory last week on a report that its parent company was about to throw in the towel, selling the asset after years of fierce competition in the local mobile phone market.

title: Huawei Unveils in-House Operating System to Replace Windows
content: Huawei Technologies Co. debuted its first in-house operating system for personal computers, offering an alternative to Microsoft Corp’s Windows as China pushes to replace American technologies amid rising geopolitical tensions.

title: Anthropic Is Trying to Win the AI Race Without Losing Its Soul
content: Dario Amodei has transformed himself from an academic into the CEO of a $61 billion startup.

title: Vodacom Eyes Africa Network Sharing as Payout Beats Forecast
content: Vodacom Group Ltd., Africa’s largest wireless carrier, declared a full-year dividend that beat analysts’ estimates and outlined plans for network sharing agreements across the region.

title: Australia Delivers ‘Dovish’ Rate Cut, Sends Yields Tumbling
content: Australia’s central bank cut its key interest rate for a second time this year, highlighting mounting trade-related uncertainty and sending the currency and government bond yields tumbling.

title: Britain’s EU Reset Turns Out to Be Just the Start of Talks
content: Prime Minister Keir Starmer heralded a “landmark deal” between the UK and the European Union on Monday that he billed as a reset moment for relations under his government. Still, with many details unresolved, Brexit never quite seems to be over.

title: Elon Musk, Qatar’s Al-Thani to Speak at Economic Forum
content: The Katara Towers ahead of the Qatar Economic Forum. Photographer: Christopher Pike/Bloomberg

title: Malaysia Trade Jumps to Near Three-Year High Amid Front-Loading
content: Malaysia’s trade rose to an almost three-year high, with exports surpassing expectations amid front-loading activity.

title: Sanctioned Russian Arctic LNG Plant Is Using New Production Line
content: Russia’s newest liquefied natural gas plant in the Arctic has begun using a second production line, even as the facility remains under stifling Western restrictions.

title: RBA Sees Unemployment Rise to Near 6% in a ‘Trade War’ Scenario
content: Australia’s central bank warned that the unemployment rate would climb to nearly 6% in a “trade war” scenario where the US re-imposes higher ‘Liberation Day’ tariffs in 2026 and all countries retaliate.

title: Japan Mulls Taxing Small Parcels as Shein, Temu Expand
content: Japan is mulling a review of tax exemptions for small parcels including those shipped from China, joining a slew of governments stepping up scrutiny over a duty-free channel used by Shein and PDD Holdings Inc’s Temu.

title: Nigeria to Hold Rates Again on Hazy Inflation Outlook
content: Policymakers at Nigeria’s central bank are set to keep the key interest rate on hold for a second straight meeting to get a better grasp of the inflation trajectory.

title: China Accuses US of Undermining Trade Talks With Warnings Against Huawei Chips
content: The Chinese government accused the Trump administration of undermining recent trade talks in Geneva after it warned that using Huawei Technologies Co.’s artificial-intelligence chips “anywhere in the world” would violate US export controls.

title: Thailand Eyes $15 Billion Cut in US Trade Gap With Export Rules
content: Thailand expects to reduce its trade gap with the US by as much as $15 billion annually with its recent initiatives to prevent the misuse of origin rules for exports, according to Finance Minister Pichai Chunhavajira.

title: India Expects Multi-Phase Trade Deal With US as Talks Proceed
content: India is discussing a US trade deal structured in three tranches and expects to reach an interim agreement before July, when President Donald Trump’s reciprocal tariffs are set to kick in, according to officials in New Delhi familiar with the matter.

title: Japan’s Kato Plans Bessent Meet to Discuss Topics Including FX
content: Japan’s Finance Minister said he’s arranging a bilateral meeting with US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent this week to discuss topics including currency matters, triggering further gains in the yen.

title: Japan Minister’s Brag About Free Rice Misfires Amid Surging Prices
content: Japan’s agriculture minister said he’d been inconsiderate after comments about his plentiful supply of free rice struck a nerve with the public, who face soaring prices in stores.

title: UK Benefit Cuts to Cause More Pain Than Gain, Think Tank Finds
content: Labour’s benefit cuts will leave hundreds of thousands more Britons in poverty even after accounting for the employment boost the government claims the reform plans will deliver, according to analysis by the Resolution Foundation think tank.

title: BOJ to Mull Pace of Bond-Buying Cutbacks After Market Meetings
content: The Bank of Japan will sound out market participants this week to gauge their views on how aggressively it should proceed with quantitative tightening as yields surge nearly a year after it began scaling back its huge bond purchases.

title: Trump Crane Tariffs Would Cost US Ports $6.7 Billion, Group Says
content: Import tariffs imposed on Chinese-built cranes could cost key US cargo handling facilities nearly $6.7 billion and inhibit infrastructure investment, according to a group that represents 81 ports across the country.

title: LA Port Shipments Fell 30% in Early May After Trump Tariffs
content: Inbound shipments to the Port of Los Angeles — the busiest container hub in the US — dropped as much as 30% in early May as President Donald Trump’s tariffs discourage trade.

title: Fed Officials Signal Rates Likely to Stay on Hold Until at Least September
content: Two Federal Reserve officials, including New York Fed chief John Williams, suggested policymakers may not be ready to lower interest rates before September as they confront a murky economic outlook.

title: Fed’s Bostic Sees One Cut in 2025 Amid Lengthy Tariff Talks
content: Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta President Raphael Bostic repeated that he sees the central bank delivering one interest-rate cut this year amid tariff-induced uncertainty.

title: Namibia Sees Uranium, Oil Driving Rebound in Foreign Investment
content: Namibia expects foreign direct investment to rebound this year after a 25% decline in 2024, as idled uranium operations restart and global companies ramp up oil exploration and green hydrogen projects.

title: Swiss Inflation Risks Falling Below Zero in Individual Months This Year, Schlegel Says
content: Switzerland’s inflation rate may fall below zero at times in 2025, according to central bank chief Martin Schlegel.

title: SNB President Schlegel Sees No Alternative to US Treasuries
content: Switzerland’s central bank chief gave a vote of confidence to US government bonds even after the world’s biggest economy was stripped of its last top credit rating by Moody’s.

title: France Touts Record Foreign Investment at Macron’s Summit
content: French President Emmanuel Macron will tally more than €40 billion ($45.1 billion) in foreign investment at an annual gathering with business leaders, seeking to send an upbeat message as the slow-growing economy faces headwinds from US trade tariffs.

title: Fed’s Logan Calls for Strengthening Rate-Control Tools
content: Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas President Lorie Logan said the US central bank should consider strengthening the mechanisms by which it keeps money-market interest rates from spiking during times of market stress.

title: Jim Millstein Says US Risks ‘Fiscal Disaster’ If Recession Hits
content: Washington lawmakers are risking a “fiscal disaster” if a recession hits as they plow on with their package of sweeping tax cuts, according to Guggenheim Securities Co-Chair Jim Millstein.

title: Galipolo Vow on Higher-for-Longer Brazilian Rates Boosts Bets on Cycle’s End
content: Central bank President Gabriel Galípolo said Brazil needs interest rates to remain at a very restrictive level for longer, boosting investors’ bets that policymakers could stop the current tightening cycle at their next meeting in June.

title: Ghana at Loggerheads With Afreximbank Over $768 Million Debt
content: Ghana, emerging from a bruising debt restructuring process, faces a dispute with African Export-Import Bank, one of its biggest commercial creditors, over whether it should take losses on a $768.4 million liability.

title: Starmer’s Reset Hailed by EU Chiefs, Slammed by UK Conservatives
content: Keir Starmer sealed an agreement with European Union leaders that lays the ground for closer collaboration with the bloc, while revealing the political peril to Britain’s Prime Minister of revisiting the terms of Brexit.

title: Jefferson Says Fed Policy in a ‘Very Good Place,’ Can Be Patient
content: Federal Reserve Vice Chair Philip Jefferson said the central bank must ensure any price increases resulting from policy changes in Washington don’t lead to a persistent rise in inflation.

title: Romania Budget Woes Put Brakes on Post-Election Market Rally
content: Romania’s assets rallied after a centrist candidate defeated his nationalist opponent in the presidential election, but further market relief may be limited until the next government presents a plan to fix state finances.

title: UBS Set to Lose First Round of Fight Over Swiss Capital Hike
content: UBS Group AG is heading for defeat in the first round of its effort to water down the Swiss government’s law that could force it to maintain as much as $25 billion in extra capital.

title: Elon Musk, Qatar’s Al-Thani to Speak at Economic Forum
content: The Katara Towers ahead of the Qatar Economic Forum. Photographer: Christopher Pike/Bloomberg

title: CATL Shrugs Off US Blacklisting for Hong Kong Debut
content: A Pentagon blacklisting, US congressional scrutiny and a global trade war haven’t been enough to stop the world’s largest maker of electric-car batteries from completing the globe’s biggest listing so far this year.

title: Sanctioned Russian Arctic LNG Plant Is Using New Production Line
content: Russia’s newest liquefied natural gas plant in the Arctic has begun using a second production line, even as the facility remains under stifling Western restrictions.

title: Pfizer Licenses 3SBio Cancer Drug for Record $1.2 Billion
content: Pfizer will pay $1.25 billion upfront to license an experimental cancer drug out of China, in a deal that underscores multinational drugmakers’ growing enthusiasm for Chinese biotech innovation.

title: Eric Trump Set to Attend Event for $1.5 Billion Vietnam Project
content: The Trump Organization is said to start construction of its $1.5 billion complex of hotels, golf courses and homes in northern Vietnam on Wednesday with a groundbreaking ceremony that will include Eric Trump among the guests, according to a person familiar with the matter.

title: Wells Fargo Says to Buy US Stocks and Cut EM After Strong Rally
content: Investors should reduce their holdings of emerging market equities and buy US stocks instead, according to Wells Fargo & Co.

title: GM Stops Small Number of Car Exports to China Due to Tariffs
content: General Motors Co. has halted shipments of a small number of US-made vehicles to China as the fallout of US President Donald Trump’s tariffs reshapes the global auto sector.

title: Goldman Sachs’ New Zealand Head Andrew Barclay to Leave
content: Goldman Sachs Group Inc.’s head for New Zealand, Andrew Barclay, will leave the firm after more than 25 years.

title: World’s Biggest Power Exchange Eyes Asia-Pacific Expansion
content: European Energy Exchange AG wants to offer more power derivatives products in Asia Pacific, highlighting overseas traders’ interest in entering the region’s markets.

title: NJ Congresswoman Charged With Assault in ICE Protest, Prosecutor Says
content: The Justice Department charged a Democratic House lawmaker from Newark, New Jersey, with assault after a confrontation with US immigration officers on May 9 at a private detention center that is central to President Donald Trump’s plans for mass deportations, a prosecutor said.

title: Chinese Banks Cut Benchmark Lending Rates After PBOC Easing
content: Chinese banks lowered their benchmark lending rates for the first time in seven months, in a move telegraphed by officials when they eased monetary policy to counter US tariffs.

title: Trump Allows Halted NY Offshore Wind Project to Resume Work
content: The Trump administration has lifted an order that halted construction on a $5 billion wind energy project off the coast of New York.

title: Brazil’s Suspected Bird Flu Cases Still Under Investigation
content: Brazil is still analyzing new suspected cases of bird flu on commercial poultry farms, raising concerns the deadly virus may be spreading in the world’s largest chicken exporter.

title: Nike Lays Off Some Workers in Shakeup of Technology Division
content: Nike Inc. is downsizing its technology division and letting go of some employees as management resets priorities.

title: Texas Measles Outbreak Slows After Major Vaccine Push
content: The rate of new measles infections in Texas has slowed as immunity to the virus builds and vaccinations rise.

title: Royal Caribbean Sheds Junk-Debt Status After Moody’s Upgrade
content: Royal Caribbean Cruises Ltd. regained its investment-grade status on Monday, as Moody’s Ratings matched the upgrade that S&P Global Ratings made three months ago.

title: NYC Developer to Buy Bank Building for Conversion to Housing
content: Developer Vanbarton Group agreed to buy a midtown Manhattan building that houses Emigrant Bank offices, with the intent to convert it to housing, according to people familiar with the deal.

title: FDA Names Acting Leaders for Inspections, Tobacco Regulation
content: US Food and Drug Administration Commissioner Marty Makary named agency veterans to lead tobacco regulation and inspections, two high-profile areas, according to documents seen by Bloomberg.

title: The Potential Cancer, Health Risks Lurking in One Popular OTC Drug
content: A widely available drug for urinary tract infections has never been formally approved by the US government. It’s not the only one.

title: LaGuardia Runway Close Call Probed by US Aviation Authorities
content: Federal safety officials are probing an incident at New York’s LaGuardia airport earlier this month, during which a Republic Airways jet had to abort takeoff to avoid a collision with a United Airlines Holdings Inc. plane taxiing on the same runway.

title: FDA to Unveil Covid Shot Policy as RFK Jr. Eyes More Tests
content: President Donald Trump’s administration is slated to lay out its approach to Covid vaccination at an event Tuesday that could spell major changes in what is required to get regulatory approval for immunizations.

title: Dimon Warns Markets Are Underestimating Geopolitical, Inflation Risks
content: JPMorgan Chase & Co. Chief Executive Officer Jamie Dimon warned against complacency in the face of a slew of risks, citing everything from inflation and credit spreads to geopolitics.

title: Chicago Investment Firm Raises $1.2 Billion for Real Estate Fund
content: Mesirow Financial Inc. raised more than $1.2 billion for its fifth real estate fund, which will focus on apartment complexes in major US metros, the company said.

title: Wynn Ditches NYC Casino Plan, Predicting Years of Opposition
content: Wynn Resorts Ltd. is dropping its pursuit of a casino license with Related Cos. in New York, citing a rezoning process and local opposition that makes the opportunity less attractive.

title: Moody’s Cuts Deposit Ratings at Major Banks After Downgrading US
content: Moody’s Ratings cut its ratings for deposits at some of the biggest banks, including Bank of America Corp., JPMorgan Chase & Co., citing Friday’s downgrade of the US and the government’s weakened ability to support the firms.

title: Nike Will Be the Winner If Dick’s Can Revive Foot Locker
content: If Dick’s Sporting Goods Inc. can turn around Foot Locker Inc. — a feat the footwear chain has struggled with on its own — Nike Inc. stands to emerge as a big winner.

title: US Battery Startup ONE Inks Production Deal With Turkey’s Pomega
content: US battery startup Our Next Energy Inc. will outsource some production of its battery cells to Turkey’s Pomega Enerji Depolama Teknolojileri AS.

title: Apple Must Resolve ‘Fortnite’ Return or Answer for It to Judge
content: Apple Inc. will have to answer to a judge for refusing to restore Fortnite to its US App Store if it hasn’t resolved its standoff with Epic Games Inc. by May 27.

title: CBS News Chief McMahon Resigns Under Pressure From Paramount
content: Wendy McMahon, chief executive officer of CBS News, resigned under pressure after Paramount Global, the broadcaster’s parent company, raised concerns about the fairness of its reporting, discord at the news division and the performance of the business, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.

title: China cuts benchmark lending rates for the first time in 7 months in Beijing's growth push
content: The People's Bank of China trimmed the 1-year loan prime rate to 3.0% from 3.1%, and the 5-year LPR to 3.5% from 3.6%.

title: California bill calls for program to insure multifamily development loans
content: Sen. Dave Cortese has called on the state to use its credit to insure construction and permanent loans for multifamily developments, giving them access to more favorable interest terms

title: Mortgage rates cross back over 7% after U.S. credit downgrade
content: After several weeks of sitting stagnant, mortgage rates surged higher Monday following Moody’s decision to downgrade the U.S. credit rating.

title: Ray Dalio says the risk to U.S. Treasurys is even greater than what Moody’s is saying
content: Bridgewater Associates founder and billionaire Ray Dalio warned Monday that Moody’s downgrade of the U.S. sovereign credit rating understates the threat to U.S.

title: 3 critical credit card debt considerations borrowers should make now
content: With interest rates high and the prospects of relief low, here are three considerations borrowers should make now.

title: Investors shrug off Moody's downgrade as stocks, U.S. borrowing costs stay largely flat
content: Investors largely shrugged off a downgrade of the U.S.' credit rating in Monday trading, as stocks ended the day mostly flat.

title: Mortgage rates cross back over 7% after U.S. credit downgrade
content: The rate on the 30-year fixed mortgage crossed 7%, hitting its highest level since April 11.

title: How climate change could hit your credit score
content: A new report finds a direct link to foreclosures from climate change and suggests as lenders factor that risk into underwriting, it could alter credit scores.

title: Hot on the red carpet: Jewelry you can’t buy
content: From Cartier to Tiffany, jewelry houses are increasingly lending celebrities rare, archival pieces from the vault to wear on the red carpet.

title: What Moody’s downgrade of U.S. credit rating means for your money
content: Moody's decision to downgrade the U.S. credit rating may have far-reaching consequences for your money, experts say.

content: The SEC’s Office of Investor Education and Advocacy unveiled its anti-fraud public service campaign, which warns investors about the devastating impact relationship investment scams can have on their financial future.

content: April is Financial Literacy Month, and the SEC is encouraging investors to utilize the agency’s saving and investing resources on Investor.gov.

content: The SEC&#039;s Crypto Task Force will host a series of roundtables to discuss key areas of interest in the regulation of crypto assets.

content:

title: Proofpoint To Buy Hornetsecurity For Around $1B
content: Cybersecurity company Proofpoint announced that it plans to acquire Hornetsecurity, a security provider specialized in Microsoft 365 software tools, in a deal reportedly valued at around $1 billion.

title: Venture Capital’s Second(ary) Chance
content: The lack of a healthy exit market is an existential problem for the venture capital industry, writes guest author Dan Gray, who sees the evolving strategy of secondary markets as one solution.

title: DFJ Growth Closes $1.2B Flagship Fund
content: Venture investor DFJ Growth announced it has raised $1.2 billion for a fifth flagship fund, its largest to date.

title: Tariffs And The Venture Value Chain: A Blip Or Long-Term Pain?
content: Guest author Rohit Yadav takes us on an exploration of the value chain — VC fundraising, startup fundraising and exits — to see how tariffs are driving both direct and indirect impacts.

title: The Longer IPOs Delay, The Less Likely Debuts Will Happen
content: Over the past couple weeks, as we’ve seen Klarna, StubHub and others delay scheduled pre-IPO roadshows, it appears markets are to blame. But how will delays affect a company's success when it finally makes its debut?

title: Crypto Startup Ripple Buys Hidden Road For $1.25B
content: Crypto payments firm Ripple is acquiring brokerage house Hidden Road for $1.25 billion in one of the biggest M&A deals ever in crypto.

title: Tariffs, Volatility And The Startup Exit Dilemma
content: Even seasoned startup investors today face what feels like a novel turn of events: a potential recession and increasing exit uncertainty due to government-induced volatility, writes guest author Don Butler of Thomvest Ventures.  For an ecosystem that has long awaited the return of robust exit volumes, the uncertainty in the markets sparked by tariffs couldn’t come at a worse time.

title: CoreWeave Closes Flat In First-Day Trading
content: Shares of CoreWeave closed flat at $40 on their first day of trading on the Nasdaq today. Shares had opened at $39 on Friday, a day when the Nasdaq sank 2.7%.

title: CoreWeave Shrinks IPO
content: Cloud computing startup CoreWeave is cutting the size of its IPO, looking for a valuation closer to $23 billion than the roughly $30 billion it had originally targeted.

title: Want To Sell Your Startup Quickly To A Strategic Buyer? Consider This From The Get-Go
content: Whether buying a startup or selling one, there are plenty of steps that need to be considered, writes guest author Murat Abdrakhmanov. In this commentary he provides recommendations to help both buyer and seller reach their strategic and financial goals.

title: The Most-Active, Spendiest Startup Investors Are Lagging Greatly In Lucrative Exits
content: The most active, highest-spending startup investors are leading a lot of large new rounds lately. When it comes to exits, however, things look much, much slower. We used Crunchbase data to examine IPO and M&A exits since 2023 for six firms that regularly top our active lead investor rankings.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: Looking Back 10 Years, Seed Investors Envisioned A Different Future Unfolding
content: Reviewing old seed funding data is a lot like going into the past to see what people thought the future would look like. Going back roughly 10 years ago, it seems OpenAI was the company every seed investor should have backed, but who knew how times would change for the intended nonprofit.

title: Global Venture Funding Slowed In April, Despite Strong AI Showing
content: Global venture funding totaled $23 billion in April 2025, flat year over year and down significantly month over month from $68 billion invested in March, Crunchbase data shows.

title: How To Leverage Your Pre-Seed Funding For Rapid And Successful Growth
content: After the pre-seed round is a time for a startup to plan for securing follow-on investments, says guest author Sergei Bogdanov, who shares early-stage funding advice to founders regarding what to do as well as what not to do.

title: Most-Active Startup Investors Spent More In Q1
content: The busiest venture backers upped their game in the recently ended first quarter. Among the 14 most-active post-seed investors, a majority backed more deals in Q1 2025 than they did a year ago.

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: SignalFire Closes On $1B To Invest In Applied AI
content: Bay Area-based SignalFire, a data-driven venture firm, has raised $1 billion for its fifth and largest fund, which it will invest in applied AI companies.

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
content: Despite several big deals that buoyed the numbers, North America early- and seed-stage investment declined to multiquarter lows in Q1, and reported round counts fell across stages.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: 7 Deadly Pitch Deck Sins, According To A VC
content: VC firms receive thousands of pitch decks a year and a typical investor will spend no more than two to three minutes assessing each one. In this guest commentary, investor Michael Tefula of Ada Ventures shares seven of the biggest mistakes that are more likely to land your pitch in the “no, thanks” rejection bin.

title: Far Fewer Seed-Stage Startups Are Graduating To Series A — Raising The Risk Of Failure
content: Companies stalled at the seed stage might be sacrificing growth to get to breakeven, which could further hinder their ability to show the traction needed to get to a Series A.
